condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: With UNICEF support, the Binational Border Service Centre (CEBAF) in Tumbes has developed protocols and service pathways to handle cases of unaccompanied and separated children. Children and adolescents' access to protection services has been strengthened, with an improved presence of the government body responsible for upholding child rights. Almost 40,000 children accessed child-friendly spaces for psychosocial support and over 500 children and adolescents received special protection services through individual case management. UNICEF continues monitoring government compliance with international standards on migrant child protection. High level advocacy efforts have been successful in addressing severe vulnerable situations. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
